components.SimpleCalendarScreen: A StatefulWidget that provides a calendar interface for viewing and managing appointments with multiple view modes (day, week, week chart).

rules: Supports three view modes: day, week, and weekChart through CalendarViewMode enum.
Loads appointments from AppointmentsStore with date range filtering based on view mode.
For week views, calculates date ranges either anchored to today or normal Monday-Sunday week view.
Always uses forceRefresh when loading appointments to ensure fresh data for calendar navigation.
Provides navigation controls: Today button, previous/next arrows, and date picker.
Shows different filter options based on view mode: staff and service filters only for day view.
Week view includes additional toggles: 'Anchor to Today' and 'Show Overlap Count'.
Service category filters exclude 'other' category and show up to 8 categories as filter chips.
Manual navigation (prev/next arrows) disables 'Anchor to Today' mode.
Tapping appointments opens ComprehensiveAppointmentDialog for editing.
Tapping time slots opens ComprehensiveAppointmentDialog for creating new appointments.
New appointment button always available in header for creating appointments.
Handles appointment save/update/cancel operations through DriftAppointmentRepository.
Updates with expanded date ranges when appointments are modified to keep them visible.
Shows loading states, error states with retry functionality.
Uses Observer pattern for reactive UI updates based on AppointmentsStore state.

components.AppointmentsScreen: A StatefulWidget that provides a comprehensive list view of appointments with filtering, searching, and pagination capabilities.

rules: Uses StandardAppHeader with navigation to calendar view and new appointment creation.
Provides comprehensive filtering: status, technician, customer search, and date range filters.
Customer search includes autocomplete functionality loaded from DriftCustomerRepository.
Supports quick date filters: Today, Tomorrow, This Week with visual active state indicators.
Shows appointment summary cards with counts for Scheduled, Confirmed, Today, Tomorrow.
Summary cards are calculated from filtered appointments, not all appointments.
Uses DataTable for appointment display with fixed column widths for consistency.
Shows appointment details: date, time, customer, technician, services, status, actions.
Services are displayed as ServicePills with truncation (first 3 + more indicator).
Status is displayed as colored chips with appropriate colors for each status type.
Technician display shows both requested and assigned technicians with clear labeling.
Appointment tapping opens ComprehensiveAppointmentDialog for editing.
Handles appointment save/update/cancel operations through DriftAppointmentRepository.
Uses client-side filtering through AppointmentsStore for responsive filter changes.
Supports pagination with PaginationControls and configurable items per page.
Uses Debouncer for customer search to avoid excessive API calls.
Shows loading skeletons during data loading for better UX.
Clear filters button shows active filter count and resets all filters.
Empty state shows helpful message and new appointment creation button.
Error state shows retry functionality with store error clearing.

components.AppointmentsStore: A comprehensive MobX store managing appointment data, filtering, searching, and caching with TTL (Time-To-Live) support.

rules: Implements 5-minute cache TTL system for optimal performance and data freshness.
Supports multiple filtering options: status, technician, customer search, date ranges.
Provides search functionality with debounced query processing.
Manages both appointments and technicians data with reactive observables.
Initial loading uses skeleton loading states for better UX.
Error handling with retry functionality and error message management.
Integrates with CacheCoordinationService for cross-screen cache invalidation.
Supports force refresh to bypass cache when needed (navigation, critical updates).
Date range filtering with start/end date support.
Customer filtering with search query functionality.
Loading states: initial loading (skeleton), regular loading (spinner).
Last loaded timestamp tracking for cache TTL decisions.
Observable lists for reactive UI updates: appointments, technicians.
Filter state management: status, technician, customer, date filters.
Repository pattern: uses AppointmentsRepository and DriftEmployeeRepository.
Settings integration through SettingsManager for user preferences.
Comprehensive error logging for debugging and monitoring.

components.CalendarStore: A specialized MobX store for calendar-specific appointment management with view modes, date navigation, and technician filtering.

rules: Supports multiple calendar view modes: day, week, month through CalendarViewMode enum.
Manages selected date state with reactive navigation (previous/next).
Technician filtering with multi-select support (selectedTechnicianIds).
Calendar-specific appointment model (CalendarAppointment) with enhanced display properties.
Date range management for efficient data loading based on view mode.
Selected appointment tracking for detailed view/editing.
Available technicians management with reactive updates.
Loading and error state management specific to calendar operations.
Computed properties for filtered data based on view and technician selection.
Integration with DriftAppointmentRepository for appointment data.
Integration with DriftEmployeeRepository for technician information.
Calendar day model for structured day-based data organization.
Time slot management for calendar grid rendering.
Calendar theme support for customizable visual appearance.
Error logging integration for calendar-specific debugging.
Reactive UI updates through MobX observables for smooth calendar interactions.

components.AppointmentCalendarGrid: A sophisticated StatefulWidget that renders the main calendar grid with technician columns, time slots, and appointment blocks.

rules: Supports paginated technician view with 8 technicians per page for performance.
Uses fixed time column width (100px) and dynamic technician column expansion.
Time slot height is 35 pixels per 15-minute increment for precise scheduling.
Header height fixed at 80 pixels for technician information display.
Vertical scrolling controller for time navigation within calendar view.
Service category filtering affects appointment visibility on calendar.
Callback system: onAppointmentTap for editing, onTimeSlotTap for new appointments.
Page navigation support with onPageChanged callback for technician pagination.
Integrates with AppointmentsStore for reactive appointment data.
Uses Observer pattern for MobX-based reactive UI updates.
Settings integration for user preferences and display options.
Current time line performance optimization moved to separate widget.
Appointment blocks rendered within technician columns with time positioning.
Handles appointment overlap detection and visual representation.
Responsive design adapts to different screen sizes and technician counts.

components.AppointmentDialogMode: An enum defining the three modes: create, edit, fromCalendar.

components.ComprehensiveAppointmentDialog: A complex StatefulWidget for creating and editing appointments with full functionality.

rules: Supports three modes: create (new appointment), edit (existing), fromCalendar (calendar overlay).
Factory constructors provide convenient creation for different use cases.
Pre-selection support: date, time, and technician can be pre-populated from calendar.
Customer search integration with CustomerSearchWidget for customer selection.
Service selection with multi-service support and duration calculations.
Technician assignment with compatibility checking via TechnicianServiceCompatibilityService.
Date and time picking with validation and conflict detection.
Appointment status management for existing appointments.
Notes and special instructions support.
Group booking support with size specification.
Real-time validation of appointment conflicts and technician availability.
Cancellation workflow with reason tracking.
Integration with drift repositories for employee and service data.
Callback system: onSave for successful operations, onCancel for cancellations.
Comprehensive form validation before save operations.
Material Design UI with proper theming and accessibility.

components.TechnicianServiceCompatibilityService: A singleton service that determines technician-service compatibility based on employee capabilities.

components.ServiceCompatibilityResult: A result class containing compatibility analysis with warning messages and suggested alternatives.

rules: Uses singleton pattern for application-wide access to compatibility logic.
Implements 10-minute cache TTL for performance optimization of capability and service category lookups.
Handles 'any' technician case by allowing all services (returns true for compatibility).
Checks technician capabilities against service categories for compatibility validation.
Provides multi-service compatibility checking with detailed result analysis.
Suggests alternative technicians for incompatible services.
Caches technician capabilities and service categories to reduce database queries.
Defaults to allowing services if compatibility check encounters errors (fail-safe approach).
Integrates with employee service categories table for capability management.
Generates human-readable warning messages for incompatible service assignments.
Supports batch operations for checking multiple services against single technician.
Cache invalidation available through clearCache() method.
Error handling with logging for all database operations.
Provides fallback default capabilities (Nails, Gel, Acrylic) if capability loading fails.
Service category lookup with fallback to 'Other' category if not found.
Technician name resolution for user-friendly error messages.

components.SimpleCalendarScreen: A comprehensive StatefulWidget for appointment calendar management with multiple view modes and filtering capabilities.

rules: Supports multiple calendar view modes: day, week, and week chart views.
Integrates AppointmentsStore for reactive appointment data management.
Calendar navigation with date-based filtering and technician selection.
Filtering capabilities by technician and service categories with toggle chips.
Anchored-to-today mode for week views starting from current date.
Real-time appointment loading with forceRefresh for consistent data.
Uses Observer pattern for reactive UI updates based on store changes.
Service category filtering with color-coded chips matching ServiceCategories config.
Calendar grid integration with AppointmentCalendarGrid widget.
Week view integration with AppointmentWeekView and AppointmentWeekChart widgets.
Comprehensive appointment dialog integration for appointment management.
Settings integration for user preferences and calendar display options.
Date range calculation for different view modes (day/week/chart).
Technician-specific appointment filtering with dropdown selection.
Calendar view mode persistence and fallback handling for deprecated modes.
Today's date anchor support for consistent calendar navigation.
Loading state management during appointment data fetching.
Error handling for appointment loading operations with graceful fallbacks.

components.AppointmentsScreen: A comprehensive StatefulWidget for appointment management with filtering, searching, and pagination capabilities.

rules: Uses StandardAppHeader with calendar navigation and new appointment creation functionality.
Integrates AppointmentsStore for reactive appointment data management.
Advanced filtering: status (All, Scheduled, Confirmed, In-Progress, Completed, Cancelled), technician selection.
Customer search functionality with debounced query processing and autocomplete suggestions.
Date range filtering with start and end date selection through date pickers.
Pagination support with PaginationControls for large appointment datasets.
Loading skeletons for better UX during data loading operations.
Appointment list display with status indicators and service information.
Service pills showing appointment services with category-based styling.
Edit appointment functionality through ComprehensiveAppointmentDialog integration.
Observer pattern for reactive UI updates based on store state changes.
Text measurement utilities for responsive layout calculations.
Debounced customer search to reduce database queries during typing.
Customer repository integration for customer name autocomplete.
Loading states and error handling for all data operations.
Calendar button integration for navigation to SimpleCalendarScreen.
Appointment status management with visual status indicators.
Integration with go_router for navigation between appointment views.

components.CalendarStore: A comprehensive MobX store for calendar management with appointments, technicians, and date navigation.

rules: Manages calendar state including selected date, view mode, and date ranges.
Supports multiple calendar view modes through CalendarViewMode enum.
Maintains technician selection state with observable list of selected technician IDs.
Stores calendar appointments as CalendarAppointment objects with full scheduling data.
Provides technician filtering with multi-select capability.
Integrates with DriftAppointmentRepository for appointment data operations.
Integrates with DriftEmployeeRepository for technician data loading.
Observable loading states for async operations with UI feedback.
Error handling with error message state for user notifications.
Selected appointment tracking for editing and detail operations.
Date range management for week/month view calculations.
Uses computed properties for derived calendar data and filtering.
Appointment selection state management for user interactions.
Calendar navigation with date-based filtering and view switching.
Real-time appointment data with reactive UI updates through MobX observers.
Technician availability tracking with calendar integration.
Calendar appointment conversion from database appointment models.
Error logging integration for debugging and monitoring calendar operations.

components.AppointmentCard: A StatelessWidget displaying appointment information in a compact card format for upcoming appointments section.

rules: Compact appointment card design optimized for upcoming appointments display.
Late appointment detection with visual indicators and time-late badges.
Time formatting with 12-hour format display (AM/PM) for user convenience.
Confirmation status badges with success/warning colors based on appointment status.
Service display modes: respects user preference for service pills vs category icons.
Service pills integration with small form factor for space efficiency.
Service category icons with size configuration for visual service representation.
Fallback service display using service IDs when full service objects unavailable.
Customer name display with proper text overflow handling for long names.
Technician information display: preferred technician name or ID when available.
Action buttons positioned at top-right: Check In (primary) and Contact (secondary).
Border color coding: red for late appointments, subtle gray for on-time appointments.
Shadow and elevation for card visual hierarchy and depth perception.
InkWell integration for tappable card interaction with proper ripple effects.
Late appointment calculation using real-time comparison with current DateTime.
Minutes-late display with compact badge format for space conservation.
Responsive button styling with proper touch targets and accessibility support.
Settings integration through Consumer pattern for reactive service display preferences.
Provider pattern integration for accessing SettingsStore configuration.
Material Design principles with consistent theming and visual standards.
Confirmation status visual indicators: green checkmark for confirmed, orange warning for unconfirmed.
Professional styling with proper spacing, padding, and visual hierarchy.
Error-resistant design with null safety and graceful fallbacks for missing data.

components.AppointmentCheckInDialog: A comprehensive StatefulWidget providing detailed appointment information with check-in capabilities and status management.

components._AppointmentCheckInDialogState: State management for appointment dialog with stage-based action buttons and group booking support.

rules: Comprehensive appointment details dialog with customer, services, and timing information.
Stage-based functionality: needs_customer, ready_to_checkin, checked_in states with appropriate actions.
Group appointment support with member chip display (planned for future domain model updates).
Service display using ServicePill components with extra-small form factor.
Status-based visual indicators with color-coded sections for different appointment states.
Date and time formatting with 12-hour format display for user-friendly presentation.
Customer information display with name and phone number when available.
Technician preference display showing requested technician information.
Expected duration display for appointment planning and scheduling purposes.
Action button customization based on appointment stage and availability.
Dialog-based interface with proper header styling and close functionality.
Scrollable content area for comprehensive appointment information display.
Status section with color-coded status indicators: scheduled (orange), confirmed (blue), arrived (green).
Group member chips with primary customer highlighting and additional member support.
Service validation with warning display for appointments missing service selections.
Future-ready group booking architecture with placeholder implementation.
Professional dialog styling with primary blue header and structured content layout.
Callback integration for check-in actions, appointment updates, and creation workflows.
Responsive design with fixed width constraints and flexible height for content.
Material Design principles with consistent theming and accessibility considerations.
Icon integration for visual section identification and user guidance.
Comprehensive information display: time, customer, services, duration, technician, status.
Error-resistant design with null safety handling and graceful fallbacks.
